>This can only happen if your flexibility is so shit
Wrong. They DO put strain on ligaments and tendons. Ever had a patella strain? You feel it even in a bodyweight ATG squat, but not when just going above parallel. Clearly the patella has a huge factor in force absorption, and so do other ligaments, like the ACL
Strain your ACL and you'll have trouble walking, much less squatting.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>29815819
I admit I dont know shit about why certain movements are dangerous or not, but after 3 or so years of squatting, 1 year of which was significantly above parallel, I have noticed that I only have knee problems when
I go above parallel.

Before when i would do between 2 and 3 plate just above parallel my knees felt weird all the time, I even went to an orthopedic surgeon to find out if I was perma fucking myself

Now I squat the same weight but always ATG and I have ZERO knee/leg issues.

A bodybuilder once told me that going below parallel isnt degrading your joints as much as it is just putting you at risk of fucking up the squat and tearing your ACL or something. Really wish a medical body would come out and give a definitive answer on what is better.
